definition: to regulate/rules and regulations/regulatory/style and structure (esp. of building)
system/to control/to regulate/variant of 製|制[zhi4]

sentences.english: Based on this theory, many countries carried out anti-monopoly reform and legal regulation on the electricity industry.
sentences.chinese: 这正是各国电力行业改革与反垄断法律规制的依据。

sentences.english: Again, analysis of government non-tax revenue into the feasibility of legal regulation.
sentences.chinese: 再次，浅析浅析了政府非税收入法律规制的可行性。

sentences.english: V. How can Anti-monopoly Law Regulate the Court of Law for Abuse of Power?
sentences.chinese: 反垄断法如何规制法院权力滥用？

sentences.english: Part three makes a study on the costs and gains of current system of electrical utility regulation.
sentences.chinese: 第三部分分析了现行电业规制制度成本与绩效。

sentences.english: Chapter II, analysis the current experience of legal regulation on patent pool abuse.
sentences.chinese: 第三部分，阐述了我国专利池运用及规制现状。

sentences.english: Chapter two is about the integration principles of standard terms.
sentences.chinese: 第二章主要分析规制格式条款的订入规则。

sentences.english: So it is necessary for our country to regulate the behavior of public enterprises restricting competition.
sentences.chinese: 为此，有必要对公用企业限制竞争行为进行规制。

sentences.english: The U. S. Plan reaffirmed the nature of financial law lies in regulation and supervision.
sentences.chinese: 方案再次和反复证明了规制与监管是金融法的品性。

sentences.english: Chapter two is the comparative research on regulations governing unmarried cohabitation in foreign countries.
sentences.chinese: 第二章是对非婚同居法律规制的比较研究。

sentences.english: Therefore, this article providessomething valuable to regulating one-man company in our country at the legal level.
sentences.chinese: 从而为我国如何在法律层面上规制一人公司提供参考。

sentences.english: The corporation laws of each states are similar but not identical .
sentences.chinese: 美国没有单一法典或法规规制商务企业法。

sentences.english: Chapter two discusses the justifiability of Antimonopoly regulatory law for abuse of IPRs.
sentences.chinese: 第二章提出反垄断法规制知识产权滥用的正当性命题。

sentences.english: The regulation of enterprises merger is an important part of Anti-monopoly Law.
sentences.chinese: 对企业合并进行规制是反垄断法的重要内容之一。

sentences.english: There are two types of model in the legislation of anti-takeover England model and American model.
sentences.chinese: 在反收购的法律规制中，可资借鉴的有英美两种模式。

sentences.english: The second part mainly approaches the problem of the controlling form term made into the contracts.
sentences.chinese: 第二部分研究格式条款之订入合同及其规制。

sentences.english: The third issue of the thesis is the theoretical analysis of anti-monopoly regulation on the Business Franchise.
sentences.chinese: 第三部分是商业特许经营领域反垄断规制的理论分析。

definition: norm/standard/specification/regulation/rule/within the rules/to fix rules/to regulate/to specify
to state in writing (laws, rules etc)
provision/to fix/to set/to formulate/to stipulate/to provide/regulation/rule/CL:個|个[ge4]
